column4: Description
Use Wolf Link charge attack on a far enemy to gain a large jump boost.
Force unequip iron boots in a 2 frame attack window to gain jump height. Moon Boots can be achieved with Jump Strike, Ending Blow, Backslice (Magic Armor only), and the jump attack.
While swimming with claw, equipping boots as you go over a slope not only ignores the slope, but also ignores gravity
Frame perfect input to slide while dismounting Epona. Can be used to cross gaps without falling.
? Somehow do the opposite of Epona sliding (Link stays still, Epona keeps running)
Epona can clip into this (and many other) terrain ramps.
Horse Call Epona from out of bounds
Force unequip iron boots while pulling a water bomb, then pull another water bomb to warp to the top of the water.
Force unequip iron boots while simulteanously walking into a rupee
Force unequip iron boots while opening an underwater chest, to warp to the top of the water.
Fall to the bottom of a body of water by falling off a ledge with dialog open.
Grab a ledge while simultaneously collecting a Rupee to softlock the game.
Between any digging and the animation of Midna landing on Link's back, dash to skip the animation.
Move most actor types by interrupting a clawshot with a fall.
Open a door backwards with an item out and map-glitch active to walk up steep slopes.
column5: Apparently this can also be done with CD streaming? How?

column4: Two well timed L-Targets allow movement while using the Clawshot.
To do this you need to launch the boomerang, press A to do a side hop and spam the boomerang key 30 times per second to slide
Similar to Clawshot L-Slides, but with Boomerang. Allows for temporary moonwalking.
Cancel Wolf Link dash cooldown with B-attack or ledges.
Wolf Link can skip the climb animation in a few spots.
Clip into any wall using a pot push to clip into a wall and a clawshot to collect a rupee to clip through any wall.
Clip through any vine wall with bombs (or Clawshot on Wii).
Link drifts position slowly while holding up an item, can clip through walls. Extremely slow, takes hours.
Link drifts position slowly while standing on a bridge in Forest Temple. TODO: Forest Temple exclusive? Maybe move to that section.
Perform a 180 degree direction change while transitioning from swimming to walking, and Link will continue in the same direction with massive speeds. HD only as far as we can tell.

Catch fish while underwater using iron boots, causing the fish to glitch out and stick to Link. These can then be "recaught" at any time by using C-down, causing various effects like hovering, fishing as Wolf Link, etc.
Apparently, somehow, doing the Amazing Fly Glitch can downclip you if you catch the fish at the bottom of a lake with iron boots. Unclear if this works on SD.
In places where Link cannot roll, if he falls, he will automatically do a roll animation, allowing him to bonk in areas where normally he cannot.
Taking controll of a chicken prevents Link from losing air, but allows him to keep falling underwater with iron boots. Adds roughly 15 seconds of extra time underwater.
Clip through walls in places where Link can hang and move sideways between concave corners. Note: Specific examples of this glitch will be included in each zone's notes.
While climbing a ledge, drop an item to get pushed out of bounds. Jump attacks can help gain height to clip back in bounds while OOB.
Movement technique to maintain speed by holding analog just outside of dead-zone.
If you get Link to fast walk like that towards certain kinds of ledges, he'll bounce off and just get into a loop of bouncing and fast walking
Bypass push/target colliders (NOT walls and floors) by frame perfectly digging to get pushed backwards a tiny amount per dig.
Flicking the stick can cause high moonwalking speeds.
Using Horse Call to summon Epona in some locations can summon Epona in a way that clips out of bounds.

column2: Sand / Snow Jump with Shield Attack
column4: Tech that enables the A button in those terrain types. Under normal conditions you cannot press A when sinking however Shield Attack enables it for a frame.

When Link clawshots a clawshottable surface such as vines or a grate from very close range, he briefly rises upon reaching the surface before falling back to the ground. While he's in the air, there is one frame on which it's possible to input a roll, sidehop, or backflip and cause Link to perform this action as though from an invisible ledge in the air, giving sidehops and backflips extra height and turning rolls into autojumps that can be done in any direction. This technique works on all versions of the game.
Pausing within a 2 frame window can keep the death fadeout / game over screen from appearing, although movement is locked.
Getting hit while rolling into a double sided wall can cause link to get pushed through the wall via the velocity from the enemy push / knockback.
Load a special "File 0" used on the Title Screen.
After performing back in time, die on "File 0" while opening file select and choosing another file. This will respawn on "File 0" (in Hyrule Fields) with the progress of the selected file.
Copies items/progress from "File 0". Die on "File 0" to regain menu controls, then save over another file.

column2: Back in Time via Lava/Sand Death
column4: Frame perfect soft reset when dying in lava or sand.

column2: Back in Time via Ooccoo Jr/Sr
column4: Soft reset on the last possible frame of doing an ooccoo warp.

column2: Back in Time Wrong Ooccoo Coordinates
column4: Use Ooccoo after back in time without watching the cutscene, and Link will respawn at the wrong coordinates
Use Ooccoo after back in time without watching the cutscene, and Link will respawn at the wrong coordinates, but spawn inside water causing Link's animations to corrupt turning into a vertical line.
Pull out Ooccoo while dying, and then choose to warp, then get revived by a fairy. This causes the Ooccoo to get stuck to Links arm. Pulling again softlocks the game.
Use the Ooccoo stuck to arm glitch, then pick up a pot to slide away.
Jump further than intended with a locked target.
Call Midna to disable all map triggers.
Interrupt Midna object warp (Meteor, Cannon, etc) with an object pull.
Use UMD to keep map glitch across the Hidden Skill fight loading zone. No other known places that this works.
Fill lantern while doing a Midna object warp (Meteor, Cannon, etc).
Ask Midna to warp an object as human (requires Early Master Sword)
Defer the map coming up after asking Midna to warp you by alternating A/B presses. Mostly TAS only, but a human can do it for a couple frames.
In some situations, we can warp in places where you are not supposed to be able to, by simply zooming into a zone and zooming out on the map. Used in City in the Sky early.
Activate text before a skippable cutscene to store the text. Might require two cutscenes with a 1 frame window between them?
Interrupt/glitch NPC dialog flags to cause many various weird game effects.

Glitch the Zant cutscene by beating Morpheel while Lanaryu is still in Twilight state. This causes Midna to retain her warping abilities despite having her powers drained. Potentially allows for skipping Sewers/Rooftop 2, but sadly softlocks later due to not being able to load the right layer of the Hyrule Castle bridge.
Corrupt enough actors that the Zant cutscene cannot properly load, causing the effects described above.
[Unconfirmed] It may be possible to trigger White Midna Glitch by dying on the same frame that Morpheel dies via a bomb explosion.
Learn Ending Blow from any Golden Wolf by using a sequence break to access the wolf before the North Faron one. You will warp to North Faron afterwards.
Learn Ending Blow from a Golden Wolf to store its location, then warp to it from another Golden Wolf.
Get the "Fish On" text after using rod duping glitches (to allow getting the text while standing anywhere), then walk through a loading zone. The text will appear on the next map.
Grab a bug and get interrupted by sliding animation into water. The cutscene will not play until Link climbs on land. Door storage was used, might not be required.
Dying has priority over many cutscenes, potentially allowing for sequence breaks.

column2: Air Replenish / Swim with Water Bombs
column4: Force unequip iron boots in water to swim with water bombs. Drop the bomb mid-swim to fill air.
Extend how long a bomb's timer last by triggering a cutscene within a few frames of pulling out the bomb. The bomb will continue to fall from gravity if done correctly.
Frame perfect bomb pull to drop a normal bomb underwater.

column2: Bombling Interrupt for Bombs Drop Delay
column4: Pull a bomb, then drop a bombling. The first bomb will have a delayed drop animation.
Get interrupted while digging, preventing Wolf Link from digging anymore
Warp as Link drowns to loop the gameover screen infinitely.
Warp as human Link just before colliding with water, and Wolf Link will upwarp to the water surface during the transform animation.
Shadow Beasts can get stuck in walls (? how) causing them to play glitchy animations.
Blocking fire arrows with magic armor on allows for the accumulation of arrows in Link's shield. There is a maximum of how many the shield can hold.
Step on a switch while bringing up the item wheel. Eventually the B button hotkey will be invisible, but still active.
Console reset gets ignored during game intro cutscene.
Obtain multiple Poe souls from the same Poes. Only works on Wii/HD inside of Arbiter's grounds, as the outdoor Poes have flags that prevent this.
Get the Poe Soul rip animation twice on the same Poe. Does NOT result in a dupe.
? Somehow glitch out the Poe to cause it to start drifting away while its soul is exposed.

Interrupt a Poe Soul grab with an item cutscene (or taking damage after reaching the Poe) to cancel the Poe Soul collection animation. This defers the collection until when the animation would have completed.
Rip a poe soul as it transitions to day time

column2: [Wii 1.0] Poe Soul Rupee Wolf NaN Warp
column4: Dive into a Poe Soul stacked on top of a Blue Rupee. The cutscene of the blue rupee will cause wolf link to warp to NaN, Y, NaN.
column5: If we could make the Y coord NaN too, this could be a Poe door skip method potentially.

column4: Grab a Poe Soul and fall out of bounds.

column2: [HD] Swim with Sword and Shield Out
column4: Begin to pull out sword, then open items and force unequip iron boots. Link should now be swimming with sword and shield out.
Escape the Fanadi (Fortune Teller) cutscenes via an Ooccoo cutscene interrupt, which keeps a temp flag set that prevents Link's save location from updating.
Use dialog boxes to manipulate the position of objects carried by a boomerang. Can also be done by drinking from a bottle.
Target with the boomerang, then press Z and then A in the next frame.
Somehow hookshotted a heart piece, collected it, but the model now hovers in front of Link and is uninteractable.
Grab an item with a boomerang after obtaining Door Storage
column5: This may be possible without door storage, see https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mXN2E-bquTg

column4: Boomerang two carryable objects (done in CitS with a nut and an Ooccoo Senior). After throwing the first, the second one will warp to Link's hands when pulling the boomerang again.

"I'm not sure on exact timing, but seems like you push R and A at the same time, or maybe A immediately after R, to target something, and immediately cancel out of the boomerang throw to 'store' the target"
Play the Howl song on the title screen after a soft reset.

Play any song. Release A once enough of the song has been played, then press A again to hit a 1 frame window near the end of the song. Do not skip the howl cutscene. If done correctly, the HUD will remain up, but will not do anything.
Temporarily control a statue after force unequipping the control rod.
Hold clawshot button (or double clawshot) and L. Then, sidejump and quickly press boomerang button. Also Can do with Dominion Rod.
Collecting multiple Rupees of the same type simultaneously on Wii 1.0 causes discovery dialogue to play for multiple rupees of the same type, which normally is not possible.
Bokoblin attacks cause them to drift backwards, and can be used to clip them through walls.

- Doing BiT puts you in Hero's Clothes
- Teleporting back to Ordon from Hyrule Castle puts you in them.
- Clearing Faron Twilight puts you in the Hero's Clothes for obvious reasons.
- Getting the Master Sword either forces Hero's Clothes as Wolf, or crashes the game in Ordon Clothes.
Collecting a heart while midna is at a dungeon exit puts the heart over midna instead of Link
Stunned Kargarok appears to bonk and drift backwards for some time, until dropping out of the sky
Shooting a bow in "no scope" mode and then inputting a frame perfect roll can cause the arrow to veer off to the bottom left of Link's position.
Faster hit, but slower control regain.
Jump attack on the very last frame possible before the shield tries to prevent jump attacking

Alternate A+B every frame when the forced Iza item wheel pops up to delay it, allowing us to pull up the item wheel anywhere. In addition, this prevents cutscenes from disabling pausing, allowing save warps in places where normally this is impossible.
Use item wheel delay to skip the Squidna cutscene
Use item wheel delay to skip the Argorok death (or any boss death) cutscene

We can break a warp using Iza's forced pause to trigger parallel universe glitch to load the end of Iza 1:
- Enter Iza's hut as human (you cannot already have lent bomb bag in your inventory or you will not be able to warp later, which is required to get the forced transform that we break)
- Pause in front of Iza, hold A and D-Pad Up (Map), then unpause (you cannot get the correct order of inputs without pause buffering here). You should hear the map come up as you are talking to Iza.
- Warp anywhere (UZR is fastest)
- When Iza's forced pause comes up, go to the collection screen and equip a different tunic than the one you are wearing, then close the collection screen
- If performed correctly, you should trigger the loading zone at the end of Iza 1 most of the time. But parallel universe glitch is somewhat inconsistent, so it will fail and you will just warp some fraction of the time
Perform IWD to save warp after learning a hidden skill, and the wolf will still be accessible, allowing learning all hidden skills from a single wolf.
Use IWD to unequip a bottle while drinking it to apply the effect and keep the bottle contents.
IWD at the correct time causes wolf link to have a corrupted texture
Activating destroyed wolf after hitting a postman trigger causes the postman to try to run towards your invalid coordinates
Similar to IWD, but A/B alternate to delay Agatha's bug menu. Seemingly useless, since the cutscene state prevents movement.
Dupe fishing rods by canceling the animation to fill memory.

Immediately after gaining sword, leave Links house. Pull the sword and do a jump attack (without having moved at all). Press L to target the kid, talk to him, and the game will crash if link is still animating.
Perform Back in Time, and game over with the title screen up. This likely exhausts the J2D (UI) memory heap.
Epona oob in south hyrule field, turn around at the right spot to crash the game
Memory leak by Rod Duping or Save Leaking under heap space pressure. Can be used to get White Midna Glitch, Desert State 8, and many other glitches.
Reset and press A one frame later. TODO: Reset menu timing?
Reset console hovering over save, 17 frames no input, 18th frame press A. For 'Save', this is a J2D memory leak. For 'Options', this is a crash. On Wii, reset and press A one frame later.
column5: Using this to alloc J2D objects into Zelda heap https://youtu.be/sUazCj0PbiM

column4: Game crashes when Riding Epona into a  the loading zone for a map that does not support Epona

column2: Fanadi Save Lock Epona Cutscene Crash
column4: Triggering a cutscene that involves Epona with Fanadi save locking enabled crashes, since Epona does not spawn with this flag enabled
Drop a fence piece without the game realizing it by pulling an object (Ooccoo, note, bottle, etc).
Reset the console while voiding on Epona to cause a crash when reopening the file.
Jump strike to get out of bounds, then void out, then this leads can lead to a crash from double loading the area.
column5: Apparently this can also be done with CD streaming.

column4: Text displacement on Ooccoo leads to future crashes on HD despite soft-reset, or a crash on the empty text box on SD.
Write data outside of the filename (256 byte range).
Use cursor breakout to write data to cursor positions 113, 130, 147, 164, 181, 198, 215, 232, or 249 to cause a console-only rendering bug.

Reset console hovering over any collectable item submenu, 17 frames no input, 18th frame press A. Hidden skills, letters, bugs, and fishing journal all crash. On Wii, reset and press A one frame later.
Similar to collectable submenu crashes, do a frame perfect armor equip while doing a soft reset. Game should crash if the right frame is chosen.
Reset console while swapping equipment (exact timing unknown). Does not crash with shields.
Open the item wheel on the same frame as the Puppet Zelda text.
Get grabbed by the Kargarok as it dies, by luring it into the water.
Die after entering the Hyrule boss door, then open the boss door again from behind.
Bonking on the sled at a high location (to get max air time), then pulling certain items during the recovery animation causes a crash.
Knock down the sled without rolling via Ball and Chain, then the race will crash on start.
Early Master Sword allows early access to observation deck, resulting in both twilight and normal actors, filling all slots.
Load any file before the Squidna cutscene, and enable Dolphin logs. As the cutscene plays, a multitide of heap alloc failures will appear in the logs.
Perform map glitch and then attempt to enter Castle Town. ? Why does this happen?

column2: Under Iza's House Map Glitch Crash
column4: Combine Map Glitch and Door Storage to get underneath some vines under Iza's house. Normally, Link should void out, but due to Map Glitch, he instead crashes. Note: If this is is a generic failure case that happens in many places, we should update this entry.

column2: Amazing Fly Glitch Room Change Crash
column4: Catching a fish with duped fishing rods can cause the fish to dangle from the rod, and unloading the fish via a room change causes a crash.
Some insane sequence of events can lead to a crash in the sound manager. Happened in Goron Mines RTA route.
Crash/freeze on loading when leaving Faron after Forest Temple in the All Dungeons category
Crash from interrupting the gale with a frame perfect knock down.
Crash from hitting the jar right next to you at the start of Iza 2, somehow.
"bonbori" fails to allocate on Wii in the logs when entering Hyrule Castle.
A heap related "E_bug" warning prints at the Arbiter's Grounds entrance

Boomerange + Pot + Void + Collision with Wall = Crash. Explainer: "the crash is happening in daObjCarry_c::check_bg_damage_proc_base where it checks if the obj has  hit the ground, and if so it tries to get a polygon attribute from the the ground below the pot. in this case it passes the check, but it seems to crash because there is no actual valid ground." - Taka

column2: Wooden Statue Without Zora Armor Crash
column4: Turning in the wood statue without Zora armor causes a game flags situation where there would be two Renados, causing the game to crash
Shooting a Lizalfos from where the small key chest is with a bomb arrow can cause a crash since they are not fully loaded (?) or something..

Corrupt a very early cutscene (which?) that causes Ilia to groom an invisible Epona. Much later, when trying to tame Epona, she is still set to the Ordon Village map, causing the tame cutscene to go haywire.
Corrupt enough actors that the Zant cutscene cannot properly load, causing the effects described above.

Prevent Demo22_01 from loading, and the master sword cutscene can't play. This puts the master sword in a broken state where interacting with it in the future causes link to pick up an invisible object.

column2: Habreno's Memory Glitch Adventures (Actor Corruption without Rod Duping)
column4: Habreno likely accidentally did Save Leaking on Wii to start a chain reaction of actor corruption, resulting in actors disappearing over the course of his run.
Steps before glitch from console boot. At the end of this video, the console was turned off. These steps set up a save file for the glitched run later.
A pre-run test, likely when the glitch was triggered. This was just him messing around before starting his next run. At about 10:56 he probably did a Save Leak.
One of the effects in his subsequent run.
Actor Corruption (probably) messes up audio in several places
Somehow this player rod duped in an area where it shouldn't be possible using known methods. Figuring out how would be a massive discovery.

column2: Horizontal Link Warp on HD in Garudo Desert
column4: Nobody else has reprod this. Float perfect? Cosmic ray?
Climb (via bomb boosted iron boots jump) to the right window containing yellow crystal. Climb right side of window, and hold forward. Link will wrong warp to other side of room
"it looked like skull kid 2 cutscene was going on but i skipped it and stayed idle somehow", causing a softlock where pause shows "unskippable" dialogue.
Full run from console boot until the glitch
Full run from console boot until the glitch
Allegedly the intro cutscene failed to play for someone on a casual Wii playthrough. No proof. Note: There is no cutscene file, so actor corruption is not the likely cause.
For some reason in a run, Devil was unable to warp the meteor.

column2: Epona cutscene skip in Kak village
Note: Both of these have been replicated with actor corruption, but neither of these runners did fishing rod dupes, so it is unclear how they accomplished this.
ToT boss key room door not closing
Warp to end of iza's game?
Snowpeak Ruins Chapel Back door not closing

column4: Possible disc glitch, this runner often has issues on this fight
The only hacked part is making the first BiT not go to title screen map but to that map instead. Everything else works as is. If we had a game over BiT like that in TWW, this would work.
